author: Charlotte Phillipp
title: Kate Hudson Says Her House Is 'Still Standing' After FiancÃ© Danny Fujikawa Stayed Behind to Help Fight Fires
text:
The actress thanked fans for checking in with her as she provided an update on her home and family's safety amid the ongoing Los Angeles wildfires
By Charlotte Phillipp Charlotte Phillipp Charlotte Phillipp is a Weekend Writer-Reporter at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2024, and was previously an entertainment reporter at The Messenger.
People Editorial Guidelines Published on January 23, 2025 05:23PM EST 1 Comments Photo: Kate Hudson/Instagram
Kate Hudson is sharing an update on her Los Angeles home amid the destructive wildfires.
On Thursday, Jan. 23, the actress and musician, 45, shared a series of videos to her Instagram Stories, in which she spoke candidly about how her fiancÃ©, Danny Fujikawa , as well as his brother, Michael, stayed behind when the rest of the family evacuated to try and help protect their house and neighborhood.
"I wanted to check in and just say thank you for all of your support and concern and thoughts and prayers for us," the Knives Out star began the candid video, as her 6-year-old daughter Rani Rose sits on the couch beside her. "We went back into the Palisades â€¦ I went back for the first time. It was a very intense day. We're very lucky our house is still standing."
"But we are in the center of a lot of our friends and people we love very much, whether they be homeowners, store owners, people who work in our community," she continued. "Theyâ€™ve lost their homes and their jobs and things, so we are definitely just trying to support our community as much as we can."
Conan Oâ€™Brien Says His Pacific Palisades Home Was Spared by L.A. Fires After Thinking 'Our House Will Go' Kate Hudson/Instagram
Hudson went on to thank her many social media followers and fans for checking in on her, and reassured her audience that she would keep everyone updated on how rebuilding and recovery are going.
"All the other people affected in Los Angeles, all the first responders, the firemen, the pilots are just incredible, and all the neighbors who stayed behind," she continued. Among the people she thanked for their brave efforts was her fiancÃ©.
Turning to Rani Rose she says, "Daddy and Uncle Michael, who stayed behind and put out spot fires. All the other brave people fighting to protect us...We're so grateful."
Satellite image (c) 2025 Maxar Technologies/Getty
Hudson and Fujikawa, a musician, welcomed Rani in 2018 and got engaged in 2021. The actress is also mom to sons Ryder, 21, and Bingham, 13.
Never miss a story â€” sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offerâ€‹â€‹, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Footage of some of the aftermath of the Pacific Palisades fire. David Hume Kennerly/Getty
Celebrities Who Have Lost Homes in the Los Angeles Fires, and What They've Said While Hudson was lucky to have her house come through unscathed, many celebrities have lost their homes in the fires, including Billy Crystal , Anna Faris , Paris Hilton , Candy Spelling , Cameron Mathison , Heidi Montag and Spencer Pratt , Ricki Lake , and Anthony Hopkins .
TV Producer Teams Up with Neighbors to Use Garden Hoses to Save 7 Homes from Deadly Eaton Fire The destructive Palisades Fire first began in the L.A. neighborhood of Pacific Palisades on Jan. 7, and has since burned more than 23,700 acres, according to the Los Angeles County Fire Department . On the other side of L.A. County, the Eaton fire also began on Jan. 7 and has burned more than 14,000 acres. Additional fires have also sprung up around the Southern California region.
PEOPLE previously reported on Jan. 16, per the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner, that there have been 27 deaths so far.
Click here to learn more about how to help the victims of the L.A. fires.
Close

author: Agencia EFE
title: NFL suma 28,7 millones de espectadores en juegos de Navidad, casi 6 veces mÃ¡s que NBA
text: La [ NFL ](https://gestion.pe/noticias/nfl/)informÃ³ este jueves que en sus tres partidos transmitidos en [Navidad](https://gestion.pe/noticias/navidad/), del lunes pasado, tuvo una audiencia promedio de 28,7 millones de espectadores, casi seis veces mÃ¡s que el pico mÃ¡s alto, de cinco millones, que lograron los cinco partidos transmitidos por la NBA. Los tres partidos de la National Football League que se realizaron fueron Kansas City Chiefs-Las Vegas Raiders, Philadelphia Eagles-New York Giants y San Francisco 49ers-Baltimore Ravens. De estos juegos destacÃ³ en el que los Raiders vencieron de forma sorpresiva 20-14 a los campeones Chiefs, con una media de 29,6 millones de espectadores, lo que lo convirtiÃ³ en el partido de la NFL mÃ¡s visto en Navidad desde la temporada 1989. LEA TAMBIÃ‰N: [San Francisco 49ers 31-13 Seatlle Seahawks: resumen y marcador final por NFL] El choque entre Philadelphia y New York consiguiÃ³ un promedio de 29 millones, y el de los gambusinos ante Ravens registrÃ³ una media de 27,6 millones. La audiencia promedio de 28,7 millones de espectadores estuvo muy por encima de la jornada de cinco partidos de la [NBA ](https://gestion.pe/noticias/nba/)que tuvo en el Celtics-Lakers, su duelo mÃ¡s atractivo con un mÃ¡ximo de 5 millones de vistas, que representÃ³ una caÃ­da del 18 por ciento respecto al Bucks-Celtics del 2022, que tuvo 6.08 millones de espectadores. En el resto de los juegos programados ese dÃ­a por la National Basketball Association, los nÃºmeros tambiÃ©n fueron a la baja. Warriors-Nuggets alcanzÃ³ 4,1 millones de espectadores, el choque entre Bucks y Knicks sumÃ³ 2.49 millones, 39% menos que Sixers-Knicks del 25 de diciembre del aÃ±o pasado. El Mavericks-Suns llegÃ³ a un mÃ¡ximo de 1,37 millones, un bajÃ³n del 42 por ciento en referencia al Suns-Nuggets de la temporada anterior. Misma tendencia descendente se observÃ³ en el Sixers-Heat, con 1,3 millones de espectadores, 73% menos que el partido que disputaron en el mismo horario Grizzlies y Warrior en el 2022, la baja mÃ¡s significativa entre los partidos de la jornada navideÃ±a del lunes anterior. LEA TAMBIÃ‰N: [Los Dallas Cowboys, la franquicia mÃ¡s cara del mundo: US$ 9,200 millones]

author: mmi
title: Jeu vidÃ©o: Â«Eternal StrandsÂ», premiÃ¨re grosse dÃ©ception de l'annÃ©e
text:
Jeu vidÃ©oÂ«Eternal StrandsÂ», premiÃ¨re grosse dÃ©ception de lâ€™annÃ©e
Une bande-annonce allÃ©chante n'accouche pas forcÃ©ment d'un excellent jeu. La preuve avec Â«Eternal StrandsÂ».
La derniÃ¨re production du studio Yellow Brick Games promettait monts et merveilles avec une jeune magicienne nommÃ©e Brynn capable de contrÃ´ler le feu, la glace et la tÃ©lÃ©kinÃ©sie au cours d'une intrigue se dÃ©roulant dans les ruines d'une citÃ© magique dÃ©sertÃ©e par ses habitants mais infestÃ©e par d'horribles crÃ©atures. Si au premier abord les dÃ©cors cartoon et la jouabilitÃ© rappellent les derniers Â«ZeldaÂ», avec la capacitÃ© de grimper sur la plupart des surfaces, le jeu atteint trÃ¨s vite ses limites, la faute Ã  un bestiaire limitÃ© et au dÃ©coupage des zones donnant la sensation dÃ©sagrÃ©able d'Ãªtre privÃ© d'une partie de sa libertÃ©.
Pire, la soit-disant synergie entre les divers pouvoirs fonctionne Ã  moitiÃ© et on se retrouve Ã  enchaÃ®ner les mÃªmes combos en boucle, quel que soit lâ€™adversaire en face. Le constat est similaire avec l'exploration. Si on dÃ©couvre de nouvelles zones Ã  visiter, des quÃªtes sans grand intÃ©rÃªt obligent le joueur Ã  effectuer un nombre aberrant d'allers-retours entre les diverses cartes et Ã  rÃ©colter une flopÃ©e de ressources pour perfectionner son arsenal.
Le positif
â€“ Une direction artistique pas mal du tout.
â€“ De belles musiques.
â€“ Un systÃ¨me de craft intÃ©ressant
Le nÃ©gatif
â€“ Trop peu d'armes, de sorts, ennemis redondants
â€“ Boucle de gameplay usante
â€“ Mise en scÃ¨ne soporifique
â€“ Le nombre d'allers-retours dans un jeu d'aventure est tout simplement indÃ©cent.
Autre souci: les combats contre les boss gÃ©ants. SÃ©duisants sur le papier car il faut les affaiblir en brisant certaines parties pour dÃ©nicher leur point faible, le manque flagrant d'endurance les rende prodigieusement pÃ©nibles. Sachant qu'il faut les occire plusieurs fois pour maximiser la puissance des incantations, la tÃ¢che semble insurmontable, voire rebutante. Dernier gros point noir: la mise en scÃ¨ne est juste catastrophique entre les plans fixes et les animÃ©s d'une laideur absolue, couplÃ©s Ã  des pages et des pages de texte que lâ€™on sâ€™oblige Ã  ingurgiter. Seule la musique magnifique sort la tÃªte haute de ce ratage. On peut Ã©galement saluer le systÃ¨me de craft qui permet de configurer selon ses dÃ©sirs.
Eternal Strands
Tous supports. Yellow Brick Games. Solo.
Ã‚ge Pegi: 12 ans.

topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->arts and entertainment
Arts, Culture and Entertainment->disinformation and misinformation

author: Theresa Reidy
title: Theresa Reidy: Truth becomes lies and lies become truth â€” the threat of AI in our election
text:
Michael Healy-Rae is out in front this [ election season](https://www.irishexaminer.com/maintopics/general-election_topic-5079420.html) with his light-hearted and entertaining use of artificial intelligence (AI) to create online content which â€˜seemsâ€™ to show him being endorsed by Taylor Swift and [ kung fu fighting with Simon Harris]( kung fu fighting with Simon Harris).
These videos are known as â€˜cheap-fakesâ€™, and Healy-Rae joins an array of politicians around the world that have used this new technology. Javier Milei, the president of Argentina, has appeared as various cartoon characters in AI-generated images, as Wolverine from the
movies, in a picture with Elon Musk, and as an animated lion taking a chainsaw to the Argentine public debt.Donald Trump posted an AI-generated image of Kamala Harris addressing a "supposed Chinese political congress" to reinforce his message she was a dangerous communist. And AI images were also used in the local and European Parliament elections earlier this year in Ireland and across the EU.
All these images were easily identifiable as AI-generated, or at the very least, as having been modified in some form.
But used with malicious intent, AI has the potential to cause real disruption, indeed chaos in an election. Threats can come in several forms. AI tools make it much easier for political opponents to engage in character assassination through the circulation of â€˜fake evidenceâ€™ in the form of images, videos, or audio recordings.
Scroll for live results in your area
Before AI arrived on all our mobile phones, editing a photo or creating a fake video was a complicated and highly skilled process, but AI tools have transformed the landscape. Images, audio and video can be generated fairly easily using AI tools. These â€˜deepfakesâ€™ can be used against any politician, but women have been especially targeted.
The president of Moldova, Maia Sandu, was the subject of a Russian disinformation attack in 2023 when a fake video circulated online that presented her as a puppet of European elites. More recently, several British female politicians were affected by the circulation of deepfake pornography videos around the July general election. There has also been a case in Northern Ireland.
Deepfake porn is political violence â€” it is designed to demean the woman politician and, as experts have argued, to push women out of the public sphere.
Fake information videos also have the potential to undermine election integrity. Voters can be falsely encouraged to go to the wrong polling station, to stay at home and vote later, to print their name on the ballot paper. Several instances have occurred already this year around the world. There is a real challenge for electoral authorities here â€” AI has huge potential to assist voters.
AI bots could answer straightforward queries from voters, but wider use of these tools may also make some voters more susceptible to damaging fake information, especially when it spreads widely in private digital networks like Telegram or WhatsApp. Electoral authorities may not even be aware the deep-fake exists.
The Irish Electoral Commission has a voluntary code of conduct which covers deceptive AI and there is also an AI Elections Accord, which all the major digital platforms have signed up to. But the speed with which deep-fakes can spread online, and the damage they can cause, mean they pose a real danger to the integrity of our electoral processes and political candidates.
Media literacy and regular public discussion of these challenges are the most effective weapon in these misinformation wars.
We should also be aware of the more legitimate ways in which AI tools intersect with politics. In many sectors, AI technologies are being used to mine peopleâ€™s data so more effective targeting of digital ads can be used to persuade us all to buy more stuff. Political actors are following suit with this enhanced form of micro-targeting.
The 2018 Cambridge Analytica scandal was the first time we heard about micro-targeting and how the first Donald Trump presidential campaign interrogated the personal data of millions of Facebook users and devised an advertising strategy that was targeted at specific groups of voters.
There is a big debate about whether this type of micro-targeting of political ads can be effective. But we should remember that â€˜effectivenessâ€™ means many things.
Political psychology research tells us it is very difficult to get people to change their political affiliations or to change their opinion on something important, but moving our attention to something else is a much easier task.
The AI tools that are available today can deliver ever more sophisticated types of analysis, on ever-increasing volumes of data. Micro-targeting is becoming much more nuanced. It could be used to reinforce existing opinions, to drive further polarisation, to distract us from more serious issues.
Ultimately, perhaps the greatest threat these technologies pose to our elections is that it will become more difficult for voters to determine what is real, and what is fake. If this happens, voters may simply withdraw from politics and come to distrust all information. Truth becomes lies and lies become truth, an outcome that is sometimes called the liarâ€™s dividend.
- Dr Theresa Reidy is a political scientist at University College Cork and a co-editor of How Ireland Voted 2020 and Politics in the Republic of Ireland

author: E.R.
title: Femme poussÃ©e sur les rails du RER Ã  Paris en 2023: le suspect mis en examen pour assassinat et Ã©crouÃ©
text:
Une premiÃ¨re expertise psychiatrique avait conclu Ã  l'irresponsabilitÃ© pÃ©nale du suspect. Une deuxiÃ¨me est en cours. Pour son avocate, la place du suspect n'est pas en prison mais en service de psychiatrie. L'homme suspectÃ© d'avoir tuÃ© une femme en la poussant en juillet 2023 sur les rails d'un RER Ã  Paris a Ã©tÃ© mis en examen pour assassinat le 6 juin, a indiquÃ© jeudi 13 juin le parquet de Paris. Ayant sollicitÃ© un dÃ©bat diffÃ©rÃ©, cet homme nÃ© en mai 1981 a Ã©tÃ© incarcÃ©rÃ© provisoirement, puis placÃ© en dÃ©tention provisoire le 11 juin.
Une premiÃ¨re expertise psychiatrique a nÃ©anmoins conclu Ã  son irresponsabilitÃ© pÃ©nale. Depuis le drame, il Ã©tait en hospitalisation complÃ¨te sous contrainte, selon son avocate. Mais l'Ã©quipe mÃ©dicale a rÃ©cemment estimÃ© que ce rÃ©gime n'Ã©tait plus nÃ©cessaire et le prÃ©fet a signÃ© un arrÃªtÃ© levant son hospitalisation sous contrainte, selon la mÃªme source. Il est donc sorti de l'hÃ´pital.
"Ils se dÃ©faussent les uns sur les autres (...). J'entends qu'il y a des parties civiles dont il faudra respecter la souffrance mais en face, il y a simulacre de justice pour quelqu'un dont on sait qu'il n'est pas en capacitÃ© de s'expliquer", a soulignÃ© auprÃ¨s de l'AFP son avocate Me Talia Coquis, "en colÃ¨re contre la machine administrative".
Pour elle, sa place n'est pas en prison mais en psychiatrie. Une seconde expertise psychiatrique, ordonnÃ©e par le juge d'instruction, est en cours.
DÃ©jÃ  mis en cause pour des faits similaires en 2011 Cet homme est soupÃ§onnÃ© d'avoir poussÃ© sur les rails, le 14 juillet 2023 au matin, une femme portant un hijab, Ã¢gÃ©e de 52 ans, qui se trouvait sur un quai du RER B Ã  la station CitÃ© universitaire dans le XIVe arrondissement de Paris. La victime s'est relevÃ©e mais n'a pas pu Ã©viter le train, qui l'a percutÃ©e et mortellement blessÃ©e.
Au moment de son interpellation, le suspect avait avouÃ© Ãªtre l'auteur des faits. Il avait aussi assurÃ© aux policiers "Ãªtre Dieu" et "devoir tuer des gens" en ciblant des "personnes faibles", avait ajoutÃ© une source policiÃ¨re.
PlacÃ© en garde Ã  vue, il avait rapidement Ã©tÃ© transfÃ©rÃ© en infirmerie psychiatrique, son Ã©tat de santÃ© Ã©tant "incompatible" avec "la poursuite de sa garde Ã  vue", avait expliquÃ© le ministÃ¨re public.
Sur le mÃªme sujet Mort d'une femme poussÃ©e sous le RER Ã  Paris: le suspect conduit Ã  l'infirmerie psychiatrique Femme poussÃ©e sur les rails du RER B: une enquÃªte ouverte pour assassinat, le suspect placÃ© en psychiatrie Ce que l'on sait de la mort d'une femme poussÃ©e sur les rails du RER B Ã  Paris En 2011 Ã  Paris, il avait dÃ©jÃ  Ã©tÃ© mis en cause pour avoir "poussÃ© un individu sur les rails du mÃ©tro, mais la victime s'en Ã©tait sortie", avait relatÃ© une source judiciaire en juillet 2023. Il avait Ã©tÃ© dÃ©clarÃ© pÃ©nalement irresponsable.
E.R. avec AFP Les plus lus
CARTES. Quel scÃ©nario pour les lÃ©gislatives? Ce que montrent les rÃ©sultats des europÃ©ennes par circonscription

author: Xinhua
title: China Focus: Turning Red Planet into green? Chinese study reveals potential of moss-Xinhua
text:
BEIJING, July 5 (Xinhua) -- A futuristic study conducted by Chinese scientists has shed light on the potential of using moss to transform Mars's barren red landscape into a lush green environment.
Scientists have recently found that Syntrichia caninervis, a desert moss that thrives in various extreme environments on Earth, is a promising pioneer plant for colonizing extraterrestrial environments.
The study, conducted by researchers from the Xinjiang Institute of Ecology and Geography (XIEG), the National Space Science Center, and the Institute of Botany under the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS), was recently published in the journal The Innovation.
Syntrichia caninervis is a globally distributed moss species that flourishes in harsh deserts, mountainous regions and circumpolar regions. It forms part of the biological soil crust.
Using samples from the Gurbantunggut Desert in northwest China's Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, one of the most concentrated distributions of Syntrichia caninervis, the researchers evaluated the moss's extraordinary resilience under extreme desiccation, ultra-low temperatures and intense radiation, as well as in a simulated Martian environment combining several of these stress factors.
They found that the moss has remarkable desiccation tolerance. Even after losing over 98 percent of its cellular water content, it can recover photosynthetic and physiological activities within seconds after rehydration.
"We subjected this moss to an air-drying regimen in the laboratory. The plants appeared green when saturated with water, turned dark green and then black as the water was gradually lost, and turned green again only two seconds after rehydration," Li Xiaoshuang, a researcher at XIEG, said.
According to Li, the plant has the special power of "drying without dying" and "freezing without dying."
"We exposed intact plants to minus 80 degrees Celsius in an ultra-low-temperature freezer for five years and to minus 196 degrees Celsius in a liquid nitrogen storage tank for 30 days. The plants survived and regenerated new branches after these low-temperature treatments," said Li.
Moreover, the researcher found that the moss can survive super-intense gamma radiation exposure that would kill most plants and can maintain vitality in simulated Mars conditions.
"Using the CAS' Planetary Atmospheres Simulation Facility, we simulated Mars conditions, which included air composed of 95 percent of carbon dioxide, temperatures that fluctuated from minus 60 degrees Celsius to 20 degrees Celsius, high levels of UV radiation, and low atmospheric pressure," added Zhang Daoyuan, a researcher at XIEG.
Mars is considered to be the planet most likely to be colonized by humans in the future. However, no life forms have been detected on Mars to date. Therefore, introducing organisms from Earth might be required to produce Earth-like conditions suitable for human life on Mars, a process scientists call terraforming.
"Terraforming will require the selection of suitable organisms from Earth or the engineering of novel organisms that can thrive in challenging extraterrestrial conditions," Zhang said.
To date, only a few studies have focused on testing the ability of organisms to withstand the extreme environments of outer space or Mars. Those studies have primarily focused on microorganisms, algae and lichens.
"Our study shows that Syntrichia caninervis is one of the toughest organisms on Earth," said Li.
"This work provides fundamental insights into the multi-stress tolerance of the desert moss Syntrichia caninervis, laying the foundation for building biologically sustainable human habitats beyond Earth," Li added.
According to Li, research is still ongoing. This includes extending the treatment period to further explore the moss's stress tolerance limits, revealing the "undead" mechanisms, and testing its performance in simulated Martian soil.
"In the future, we plan to conduct space flight experiments involving exposure to space conditions," Zhang added. "We eagerly anticipate witnessing what a terraformed Mars might look like." â–

author: Sputnik Mundo
title: China responde a EEUU: "Ustedes son el mayor perpetrador de ciberataques" - 01.02.2024
text: China responde a EEUU: "Ustedes son el mayor perpetrador de ciberataques" Â© Foto : Sora ShimazakiCiberataque (imagen referencial) Â© Foto : Sora Shimazaki SÃ­guenos en Las acusaciones de EEUU en el sentido de que China estarÃ­a preparando un supuesto ataque cibernÃ©tico contra infraestructura estratÃ©gica del paÃ­s norteamericano "es infundada", "extremadamente irresponsable" y constituye "una completa distorsiÃ³n de los hechos", afirmÃ³ este 1 de febrero el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la naciÃ³n asiÃ¡tica. "China se opone firmemente y reprime todas las formas de ciberataques de acuerdo con la ley. Sin pruebas vÃ¡lidas, Estados Unidos llegÃ³ a una conclusiÃ³n injustificada e hizo acusaciones infundadas contra China", [afirmÃ³](https://www.mfa.gov.cn/eng/xwfw_665399/s2510_665401/202402/t20240201_11238222.html)el portavoz de la cancillerÃ­a china, Wang Webin, en conferencia de prensa en PekÃ­n. El vocero respondiÃ³ de esta manera a los seÃ±alamientos del director del BurÃ³ Federal de Investigaciones (FBI), Christopher Wray, quien habÃ­a dicho previamente, al [comparecer](https://selectcommitteeontheccp.house.gov/committee-activity/hearings/hearing-notice-ccp-cyber-threat-american-homeland-and-national-security)ante un comitÃ© de la CÃ¡mara de Representantes, que "China estaba preparando una amplia operaciÃ³n de piraterÃ­a informÃ¡tica" dirigida a derribar las infraestructuras civiles de Estados Unidos, como la red elÃ©ctrica, los oleoductos y los sistemas de abastecimiento de agua. Wray afirmÃ³ que la supuesta intenciÃ³n de China es "sembrar la confusiÃ³n, minar la voluntad de lucha de Estados Unidos y obstaculizar el despliegue de recursos por parte del EjÃ©rcito estadounidense" si PekÃ­n y Washington tienen eventualmente un conflicto militar en el estrecho de TaiwÃ¡n. "El propio Estados Unidos es el origen y el mayor perpetrador de ciberataques. El Mando de la Fuerza CibernÃ©tica de Estados Unidos declarÃ³ abiertamente que las infraestructuras crÃ­ticas de otros paÃ­ses son un objetivo legÃ­timo de los ciberataques estadounidenses", sostuvo el portavoz Wang al responder una pregunta sobre las declaraciones de Wray. "Desde el aÃ±o pasado, las agencias de ciberseguridad chinas han publicado informes que revelan los ciberataques que el Gobierno estadounidense lleva a cabo desde hace tiempo contra las infraestructuras crÃ­ticas de China. Esta polÃ­tica y prÃ¡cticas irresponsables han expuesto a las infraestructuras crÃ­ticas mundiales a enormes riesgos", agregÃ³ el vocero del Ministerio chino de Exteriores. "Instamos a Estados Unidos a poner fin a su ciberespionaje y sus ciberataques en todo el mundo, y a dejar de difamar a otros paÃ­ses con la excusa de la ciberseguridad", aÃ±adiÃ³ Wang, de acuerdo con una transcripciÃ³n de la conferencia de la CancillerÃ­a china. Expertos consultados por el diario chino Global Times dijeron que las declaraciones de Wray solo buscan que el Congreso de Estados Unidos apruebe mayores partidas de dinero para agencias como el FBI. "El propÃ³sito de los funcionarios estadounidenses al exagerar repetidamente la teorÃ­a de la amenaza china sin fundamento aÃ±o tras aÃ±o es muy simple: dinero, dinero y dinero, para poder pedir mÃ¡s fondos al Congreso", seÃ±alÃ³ Song Zhongping, un experto militar chino y comentarista de televisiÃ³n, al Global Times. LÃ¼ Xiang, experto en estudios estadounidenses e investigador de la Academia China de Ciencias Sociales, asegurÃ³ al mismo medio que "Estados Unidos lleva muchos aÃ±os exagerando la cuestiÃ³n de la amenaza a la ciberseguridad, acusando a China y Rusia sin pruebas concluyentes. De hecho, Estados Unidos tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ intentando legitimar sus ciberataques contra otros paÃ­ses, por lo que algunos de sus polÃ­ticos estÃ¡n siendo paranoicos y creen que otros paÃ­ses estÃ¡n haciendo lo mismo a Estados Unidos, pero no han aportado pruebas". Departamentos gubernamentales estadounidenses como el Departamento de Defensa, la CIA y el FBI estÃ¡n obsesionados con exagerar la teorÃ­a de la supuesta amenaza china en todos los temas, y aparte de pedir mÃ¡s fondos, tambiÃ©n intentan buscar mÃ¡s poder, dijeron los expertos al periÃ³dico chino. text:
